On January 6th, all teachers gathered for our Professional Development Learning Day. The purpose of the event was to understand the key principles of equity, race and culture; examine individual and collective journey of Race and Biases; analyze how privilege impacts identity development; and develop PBL lessons through the lens of culture.

We had a packed day, full of exercises, lectures and activities! Our staff was very engaged, eager to learn and help apply the information to everyday life on campus.

This content-rich event helps support our teachers’ and district’s efforts of providing a school where we implement equity, understand institutional inequities and systematic racism, and use the information to promote engagement and conversation about such important topics.

We are committed to reaching our goals in this area. With this effort, we are closer to achieving them! #EmpowerInspireUnite

In February, we begin the annual celebration of African Americans and their achievements and central roles in our history. We celebrate African American educators, politicians, civil rights activists, boxers, world leaders, novelists, abolitionists, physicians, artists and musicians. It is an important time to reflect and highlight the positive impact they have made in our society.

To celebrate their achievements, each grade level is developing a Project Based Learning (PBL) unit using the Social Justice and the Global Citizenship Standards. These standards encourage students to assess their identity, understand diversity, discuss social injustices and take action against bias and injustice. Students will plan a culminating event in history and will have the opportunity to share what they have learned with their peers. #EmpowerInspireUnite

There is tremendous talent in our Mt. Pleasant schools and community. We know that Hollywood’s next actors, actresses, writers, producers, directors and entertainers are amongst us. For this reason, we have an exciting new partnership with Children’s Musical Theater (CMT), a local San Jose nonprofit organization dedicated to training and educating today’s youth through musical theater. CMT is working with Valle Vista Elementary students and staff thanks to a three-year grant we received, with this year being our first year. As part of the grant, they are able to watch live plays for free! Ms. Clare and Ms. Amanda from CMT meet weekly with our students and help them practice warm up exercises, singing and provide dancing lessons.

Here is a brief video clip of one of their recent practices. Kudos to all of the students involved in this wonderfully creative and expressive program! MPESD has talent!
﻿
Stay tuned for our production of Disney Aladdin Kids Jr. coming December 13, 2019!

This annual event honors some of Santa Clara County's best teachers, each selected by their respective school districts. The Teacher Recognition Celebration is the oldest and largest celebration of teachers in California and the most prestigious local award given to classroom teachers.

Please join us in recognizing Jhordane Tomas, our MPESD Teacher of the Year from Robert Sanders Elementary. In this short video, we get to learn more about Ms. Tomas through the eyes and words of her students. You don’t want to miss this!
